alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 15 at 3:15PM AKDT until March 16 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Snow Followed by Heavy Rain for Southeast Alaska... .Snow continues to fall over the central and northern Panhandle through late Thursday. Heavy snow over the far northern Panhandle will last thought Thursday night, especially at higher elevations and locations along the border. Timing of the warming temperatures and the switch from snow over to rain for the Icy Strait Corridor is less certain and has been delayed. 2 to 5 inches of snow is still expected over the Icy Strait Corridor but possibly more with the delayed change to rain. For Yakutat moderate snow accumulations through Thursday evening before the main plume of moisture is expected to shift to west with significant snow accumulations expected through Friday morning. Still some uncertainty on where the plume of moisture tracks so this event will be monitored closely. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow followed by heavy rain. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel on the Haines Highway will be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to change to rain by Thursday morning with warming temperatures. Heavy rain on existing snow pack and icy roads will make very slick conditions and travel difficult. Ponding of water in culverts, roadways, driveways, and yards is likely.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
